Name: Cheri Berry
Description: This bright red Berry is very spicy and has a provocative flavor. It blooms with delicate; pretty flowers. It cures Paralysis when eaten.

Name: Chesto Berry
Description: This Berry's thick skin and fruit are very tough and dry tasting. However; every bit of it can be eaten. It cures Sleep when eaten.

Name: Pecha Berry
Description: Because of its hollow inside pocket; there isn't a lot to eat. What can be eaten is very sweet and delicious. It cures Poisoned and Badly Poisoned when eaten.

Name: Rawst Berry
Description: If the leaves grow longer and curlier than average; this Berry will have a somewhat-bitter taste. It cures a Burn when eaten.

Name: Aspear Berry
Description: This Berry's peel is hard; but the flesh inside is very juicy. It is distinguished by its bracing sourness. Eaten when frozen to thaw out. Make sure it's equipped first!

Name: Leppa Berry
Description: It's quite popular; although it takes a lot of time and care to grow. The smaller Berries taste better. It can be eaten to restore a move's PP by 10.

Name: Oran Berry
Description: Nature's gifts came together as one in this incredibly healthy Berry. It has a wondrous mix of flavors that spread in the mouth. It restores 100 HP.

Name: Oren Berry
Description: Lookalike item for the Oran Berry. An Oran Berry with a blue stem instead of white. Instead of healing the user; it deals 10 damage. Be careful!

Name: Persim Berry
Description: The more this berry absorbs energy from sunlight; the more vividly colorful it grows. It cures a Confusion when eaten.

Name: Lum Berry
Description: This Berry's gradual process of storing nutrients beneficial to Pokémon health causes it to mature slowly. It cures all status problems.

Name: Sitrus Berry
Description: Somehow came from the same family as Oran. It is larger and smoother tasting. Some Pokemon call it miraculous. It fully restores all HP when eaten.

Name: Figy Berry
Description: This Berry is oddly shaped; appearing as if someone took a bite out of it. It is packed full of spicy substances. It restores 300 HP when eaten. Confuses Pokémon that dislike spicy flavor.

Name: Wiki Berry
Description: It is said that this Berry grew lumps to help Pokémon grip it; allowing propagation farther afield. It restores 300 HP when eaten. Confuses Pokémon that dislike dry flavor.

Name: Mago Berry
Description: This Berry progressively curves as it grows. The curvier the Berry; the sweeter and tastier. It restores 300 HP when eaten. Confuses Pokémon that dislike sweet flavor.

Name: Aguav Berry
Description: This Berry turns bitter toward the stem. The dainty flower it grows from doesn't absorb much sunlight. It restores 300 HP when eaten. Confuses Pokémon that dislike bitter flavor.

Name: Iapapa Berry
Description: This Berry is very big and sour. The juiciness of the pulp accentuates the sourness. It restores 300 HP when eaten. Confuses Pokémon that dislike sour flavor.

Name: Razz Berry
Description: A small hint of spiciness lingers in the red granules surrounding this Berry. Their centers have a dry taste. If thrown at a Pokemon before throwing an Apricorn; they'll be much more likely to join.

Name: Bluk Berry
Description: Though this small; delicately skinned Berry is blue in color; it dyes the mouth black when eaten. If thrown at a Pokemon before throwing an Apricorn; they will level up right after joining.

Name: Nanab Berry
Description: Bitter; but with a trace of sweetness; the Nanab Berry was one of the very first to be discovered in the world. If thrown at a Pokemon before throwing an Apricorn; they'll be Immobilized in case of failure.

Name: Wepear Berry
Description: The potent mix of bitter and sour in this Berry seems to promote digestion. The flower is white and beautiful. If thrown at a Pokemon before throwing an Apricorn; they'll be fully healed after joining.

Name: Pinap Berry
Description: It is said that when the sour skin is peeled; this spicy Berry can be crushed to make medicine. If thrown at a Pokemon before throwing an Apricorn; they'll start with higher Connection when joining.

Name: Kelpsy Berry

Name: Qualot Berry

Name: Hondew Berry

Name: Grepa Berry

Name: Cornn Berry
Description: Its dryness is quite strong. As a result; its true deliciousness can't be appreciated by just eating one or two. It's quite expensive and sought after. Drops Crit Chance by 1 stage; but increases Connection and IQ by 1.

Name: Magost Berry
Description: The grown-up flavor and dreamy sweetness of this Berry make it a favorite of Pokémon everywhere. It's quite expensive and sought after. Drops Accuracy by 1 stage; but increases Connection and IQ by 1.

Name: Rabuta Berry
Description: Even though it is bitter; it should be eaten peel and all. The hair on the peel cleans the stomach from the inside. It's quite expensive and sought after. Drops Evasion by 1 stage; but increases Connection and IQ by 1.

Name: Nomel Berry

Name: Spelon Berry
Description: So spicy is the Spelon Berry that; Fire type or not; Pokémon will try to breathe fire after eating a single one. It's quite expensive and sought after.

Name: Pamtre Berry

Name: Watmel Berry

Description: One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones. If the team has a Key Stone as well; it allows Sharpedo to Mega Evolve into Mega Sharpedo.

Name: Slowbronite
Description: One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones. If the team has a Key Stone as well; it allows Slowbro to Mega Evolve into Mega Slowbro.

Name: Steelixite
Description: One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones. If the team has a Key Stone as well; it allows Steelix to Mega Evolve into Mega Steelix.

Name: Pidgeotite
Description: One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones. If the team has a Key Stone as well; it allows Pidgeot to Mega Evolve into Mega Pidgeot.

Name: Glalitite
Description: One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones. If the team has a Key Stone as well; it allows Glalie to Mega Evolve into Mega Glalie.

Name: Diancite
Description: One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones. If the team has a Key Stone as well; it allows Diancie to Mega Evolve into Mega Diancie.

Name: Cameruptite
Description: One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones. If the team has a Key Stone as well; it allows Camerupt to Mega Evolve into Mega Camerupt.

Name: Lopunnite
Description: One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones. If the team has a Key Stone as well; it allows Lopunny to Mega Evolve into Mega Lopunny.

Name: Salamencite
Description: One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones. If the team has a Key Stone as well; it allows Salamence to Mega Evolve into Mega Salamence.

Name: Beedrillite
Description: One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones. If the team has a Key Stone as well; it allows Beedrill to Mega Evolve into Mega Beedrill.

Name: Life Orb
Description: An orb that raises the whole team's Attack and Special Attack by 3 stages; but halves their HP.

Name: Toxic Orb
Description: An orb that inflicts Badly Poisoned on every enemy in the current room.

Name: Flame Orb
Description: An orb that inflicts Burn on every enemy in the current room.

Name: Adrenaline Orb
Description: Summons all wild Pokemon to the same room as the user. Doesn't work in corridors.

Name: Align Orb
Description: It makes the HP of all teammates equal the highest HP among them.

Name: All Dodge Orb
Description: Using it boosts the evasiveness of the Pokemon's party on the floor by 1 stage.

Name: All Hit Orb
Description: User and team go into a Focus Energy status for a short time; raising the critical hit ratio.

Name: All Mach Orb
Description: An orb that raises the whole team's Movement Speed by 1 stage.

Name: All Power Up Orb
Description: A powerful orb that raises the Attack and Special Attack of all teammates on the floor by 1 stage.

Name: All Protect Orb
Description: An orb that gives all teammates the Protect status condition.

Name: Apathy Orb
Description: Using it creates the apathetic condition on the floor and makes enemy Pokémon drop any items they may have.

Name: Beatup Orb
Description: Warps all teammates around the foe that is closest to the leader.

Name: Blowback Orb
Description: Knocks a distant target flying. If the target hits a wall or another Pokémon; it sustains 10 damage.

Name: Cleanse Orb
Description: Sticky; gummed-up items are cleansed of grime; making them usable again

Name: Decoy Orb
Description: Changes the status of the target to Decoy; making it the target of fellow Pokémon.

Name: Deposit Orb
Description: It sends a selected item to the Deposit Box.

Name: Drought Orb
Description: Drains water and magma from the dungeon floor.

Name: Emera Up Orb
Description: Using it adds 1 notch for an emera to a looplet. But the notch is available only until the end of the dungeon.

Name: Enemy Discord Orb
Description: Using it creates the Enemy Discord condition on the floor and makes enemy Pokémon unable to use Connections; Alliances or Team Attacks.

Name: Enemy Evolve Orb
Description: Using it evolves enemy Pokémon in the same room; but it has no effect on the Pokemon's teammates.

Name: Enemy Devolve Orb
Description: Using it devolves enemy Pokémon in the same room; but it has no effect on the Pokemon's teammates.

Name: Escape Orb
Description: An escape item that instantly warps the team out of the dungeon to safety.

Name: Evasion Orb
Description: A stat-boosting item that raises the user's evasiveness by 2 stages.

Name: Fill In Orb
Description: An orb that fills in all holes on the floor; removing all holes; gullies; water; or lava.

Name: Petrify Orb
Description: An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Petrified status condition.

Name: Foe Hold Orb
Description: An item that afflicts all enemies on the entire floor with a Petrified status condition.

Name: Foe Fear Orb
Description: An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Terrified status condition.

Name: Foe Seal Orb
Description: An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Paused status condition.

Name: Hail Orb
Description: A climate-control item that changes the dungeon floor's weather to a Hail condition.

Name: Health Orb
Description: Using it heals bad status conditions; resets lowered stats of the Pokemon's party; and makes the Pokemon's party healthy. Being healthy prevents bad status conditions or a reduction in stats.

Name: Hurl Orb
Description: A weapon item that hurls the target toward a random enemy Pokémon to inflict 10 damage.

Name: Identify Orb
Description: A sensor item that indicates on the map if the Pokémon on the floor are holding items or not.

Name: Invisify Orb
Description: An item that temporarily gives the user's team an Invisible status. A Pokémon with the Invisible status is cloaked from view.

Name: Itemizer Orb
Description: A horrifying orb that turns the target Pokemon into an item. If it rebounds the user will be turned into an item; so make sure you have a Reviver Seed on hand!

Name: Lasso Orb
Description: Gathers and immobilizes enemy Pokémon in the same room into one place.

Name: Lob Orb
Description: A weapon item that inflicts damage on any Pokémon in an X pattern; passing through walls.

Name: Longtoss Orb
Description: An item that gives Long Toss status to the user; which makes any item thrown by the user fly until it hits a wall or a Pokémon. It has no effect on thrown rocks.

Name: Luminous Orb
Description: A mapping item that reveals the entire floor layout to the user.

Name: Mobile Orb
Description: An item that gives a Mobile status to the user. A Pokémon with Mobile can move through walls and gullies and walk on lava and water.

Name: Monster Orb
Description: Using it changes the room to a Monster House. Make sure you're well equipped!

Name: Mug Orb
Description: A weapon item that inflicts 10 damage on the target; even at a distance. It also steals the target's hold item and makes it the user's. This added affect works only if the user is not holding an item.

Name: Nullify Orb
Description: Using it nullifies the Abilities of enemy Pokémon on the entire floor.

Name: Observer Orb
Description: Changes the status of the target to Paused; making it incapable of action.

Name: One Room Orb
Description: A destructive item that tears down all walls on the floor; turning the floor into one vast; open room. This might trigger Monster Houses so be careful!

Name: One Broom Orb
Description: Lookalike Item for One-Room Orb. Using this will spawn a broom that will sweep away every item from the entire floor!

Name: One Shot Orb
Description: A weapon item that has a 10% chance of instantly defeating the target in one shot. It doesn't seem to work on Legendary or Mythical Pokemon....

Name: Pierce Orb
Description: An item that gives Pierce status to the user; which makes any item thrown pierce through walls and all Pokémon it hits without stopping.

Name: Possess Orb
Description: Using this orb gives the whole team the Destiny Bond status.

Name: Pounce Orb
Description: An item that makes the user pounce towards the first Pokémon in its line of sight; no matter how distant. If there are no Pokémon in that direction; the user leaps to the wall.

Name: Quick Orb
Description: An item that boosts the Speed of the user and team members in the room by 1 stage.

Name: Radar Orb
Description: A sensory item that reveals the location of all enemies on the floor.

Name: Rainy Orb
Description: A climate-control item that changes the dungeon floor's weather to a Rain condition.

Name: Rebound Orb
Description: An item that changes the user's status to Mini Counter; which enables the user to make certain types of moves and enemy attacks rebound; returning part of the damage

Name: Revive All Orb
Description: Using it revives all of the Pokemon's fainted teammates.

Name: Reviver Orb
Description: Functions exactly like a Reviver Seed; but it cannot be accidentally eaten; not even by enemy Pokemon. Phew!

Name: Rocky Orb
Description: A weapon item that inflicts 30 damage on the target. It also reduces the target's Movement Speed by 1 level.

Name: Rollcall Orb
Description: A warping item that draws all team members to the user.

Name: Sandy Orb
Description: A climate-control item that changes the dungeon floor's weather to a Sanstorm condition.

Name: Scanner Orb
Description: A sensory item that reveals the location of all items on the floor.

Name: See Trap Orb
Description: A sensory item that reveals all hidden traps in the floor.

Name: Shocker Orb
Description: An item that afflicts a distant target with a Cowering status condition. A Pokémon with the Cowering status will find that its attacks go in the opposite direction on its aim.

Name: Silence Orb
Description: An item that afflicts a distant target with a Muzzled status condition. A Pokémon with the Muzzled status is incapable of using moves or items that require the use of its mouth.

Name: Sizebust Orb
Description: A weapon item that inflicts damage on the target. The bigger the target's size; the greater the damage.

Name: Slow Orb
Description: A status item that reduces the Movement Speed of all enemies in the room by 1 level.

Name: Slumber Orb
Description: An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Sleep status condition. A Pokémon that has a Sleep status is incapable of action.

Name: Snatch Orb
Description: An item that gives Snatch status to the user. This status lets the user steal the effects of all moves used by Pokémon on the floor.

Name: Spurn Orb
Description: An item that warps all enemies in the room to random locations on the floor.

Name: Spun Orb
Description: Lookalike item for Spurn Orb. Using this will create a Spin Trap underneath the user!

Name: Stairs Orb
Description: A sensory item that shows the location of the floor's stairway.

Name: Stayaway Orb
Description: An item that afflicts an enemy in the user's line of sight with a Petrified status; then warps it on the floor's stairs.

Name: Sunny Orb
Description: A climate-control item that changes the dungeon floor's weather to a Sunny condition.

Name: Surround Orb
Description: It draws the Pokemon's teammates around the leader.

Name: Switcher Orb
Description: An item that makes a distant Pokémon switch places with the user.

Name: Toss Orb
Description: Equipping this item forces the holder to waste a turn to throw it. They can't resist...

Name: Totter Orb
Description: An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Confused status condition. A Pokémon with the Confused status condition will find that its movements and attacks go astray.

Name: Transfer Orb
Description: An item that transforms the target into a different Pokémon.

Name: Trapper Orb
Description: An item that sets a trap on the user's tile. The type of trap is randomly determined.

Name: Trawl Orb
Description: An item that pulls all items on the floor to the user. It can't pull items from a shop though.

Name: Two Edge Orb
Description: An attack item that cuts the HP of all enemies in the room to just 1 HP. But the same will happen to the Pokemon's whole team! It doesn't seem to work on Legendary or Mythical Pokemon...

Name: Warp Orb
Description: An item that warps a distant Pokémon to a different spot on the floor.

Name: All Aim Orb
Description: An orb that raises the whole team's accuracy by 1 stage.

Name: Endure Orb
Description: An orb that allows the team to endure any attack with at least 1 HP.

Name: Freeze Orb
Description: An orb that freezes all enemies in the same room.

Name: Halving Orb
Description: An orb that halves the HP of all enemies in the same room. It doesn't seem to affect Legendary or Mythical Pokemon...

Name: Invert Orb
Description: An orb that temporarily reverses all type matchups.

Name: Mirror Orb
Description: An orb that protects the team with a barrier that reflects status moves.

Name: Trapbust Orb
Description: An orb that destroys all traps on the floor.

Name: Weather Orb
Description: A climate-control orb that changes the dungeon floor's condition depending on the user's type.

Name: Roto Hatch
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Makes Pokemon Eggs hatch 10% faster for a day.

Name: Roto Bargain
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Reduces the prices of products at Kecleon Shop by 10% for a day.

Name: Roto Prize
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Increases the amount of ₽ found by 10% for a day.

Name: Roto Experience
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Increases the Exp. Points the team receives in battle by 10% for a day.

Name: Roto Friendship
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Temporarily increases Connection with the team by 10 for a day.

Name: Roto Encounter
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Increases the chance of encountering high-level wild Pokémon for a day.

Name: Roto Stealth
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Increases the chance of encountering low-level wild Pokémon for a day.

Name: Roto HP
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Doubles the natural HP regeneration for a day.

Name: Roto PP
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Increases the max PP of moves by 50% for a day.

Name: Roto Boost
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Raises a random stat by 1 stage for a day.

Name: Roto Catch
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Increases the chances to recruit a Pokemon with an Apricorn by 10% for a day.

Name: Electric Seed
Description: When held; Consumed on Electric Terrain and raises the holder's Defense by one stage.

Name: Psychic Seed
Description: When held; Consumed on Psychic Terrain and raises the holder's Special Defense by one stage.

Name: Misty Seed
Description: When held; Consumed on Misty Terrain and raises the holder's Special Defense by one stage.

Name: Grassy Seed
Description: When held; Consumed on Grassy Terrain and raises the holder's Defense by one stage.

Name: Ban Seed
Description: Eating it causes all Pokemon on the floor to have the user's last move disabled.

Name: Blast Seed
Description: Eating it makes the user attack 1 tile in front of user with a blast; causing 100 damage!

Name: Doom Seed
Description: Throwing it at a Pokemon lowers their level by 1. Don't miss because wild Pokemon can do the same!

Name: Dough Seed
Description: It is a Lookalike Item for the Doom Seed. Eating it makes more ₽ appear on the next floor.

Name: Encourage Seed
Description: Eating it gives user the Encouraged status.

Name: Energy Seed
Description: Eating it fully restores the Pokemon's HP; and temporarily increases the Pokemon's Max HP by 10!

Name: Eyedrop Seed
Description: Eating it cures the Blinker status and gives user the Eyedrops status.

Name: Dropeye Seed
Description: It is a Lookalike Item for the Eyedrop Seed. A food item that gives the Dropeye status; where the immediate surrounding area will be dark; even in rooms.

Name: Famous Seed
Description: A Plain Seed... but unlike other Plain Seeds; it's very sought after for some reason.

Name: Golden Seed
Description: It's one of the Golden Items; with a golden glow. They say eating it boosts the Pokemon's level by 3.

Name: Heal Seed
Description: A healthy seed; eating it removes any and all status conditions.

Name: Hunger Seed
Description: Eating it depletes the Pokemon's Belly by 10... there must be a use case for this.

Name: Joy Seed
Description: A delicious seed that increases the Pokemon's level by 1.

Name: Life Seed
Description: A healthy seed that permanently increases the Pokemon's Max HP by 1.

Name: Plain Seed
Description: Eating it has no particular effect. It's really an ordinary seed.

Name: Pure Seed
Description: A seed that warps the Pokémon close to the stairs.

Name: Quick Seed
Description: Eating it boosts the Pokemon's Movement Speed for a little while.

Name: Tiny Reviver Seed
Description: Eating it has no particular effect; but if a Pokemon faints with one; it revives them with 1 HP; then turns into a Plain Seed.

Name: Reviver Seed
Description: Eating it has no particular effect; but if a Pokemon faints with one; it revives them with fully restored HP; PP; and Belly; then turns into a Plain Seed.

Name: Reviser Seed
Description: It is a Lookalike Item for the Reviver Seed. But what does it do when the user faints...?

Name: Max Reviver Seed
Description: Eating it has no particular effect; but if a Pokemon faints with one; it revives them with fully restored HP; PP; and Belly; heals all negative status conditions and preserves positive ones; eliminates stat debuffs and preserves buffs; then turns into a Plain Seed.

Name: Sleep Seed
Description: Throwing it at a Pokemon puts them to Sleep.

Name: Slip Seed
Description: It is a Lookalike Item for the Sleep Seed. Eating it gives the Slip status; where it is possible to walk on water.

Name: Soothing Seed
Description: Eating it resets all stats back to normal.

Name: Stun Seed
Description: Throwing it at a Pokemon causes them to be Petrified.

Name: Totter Seed
Description: Throwing it at a Pokemon causes them to be Confused.

Name: Training Seed
Description: Eating it gives user the Training condition; which boosts the growth of moves.

Name: Vanish Seed
Description: Eating it gives user the Invisible condition.

Name: Violent Seed
Description: A mysterious seed; imbued with shadow energy... eating it raises the Pokemon's Attack and Special Attack to the absolute maximum! But then...?

Name: Warp Seed
Description: Eating it warps user to a different place on the floor.

Name: X Eye Seed
Description: Throwing it at a Pokemon gives them the Cross Eyed status.

Name: Blinker Seed
Description: A seed that gives the Blinker status.

Name: Decoy Seed
Description: A seed that gives the Pokémon the Decoy status; making it a target of everyone's attacks. Enemy moves that target the team's inventory will always pick this item first.

Name: Ice Seed
Description: A seed that freezes the Pokémon for many turns.

Name: Last Chance Seed
Description: A seed that sets the PP of the Pokémon's moves to 1; and raises its Attack; Special Attack; and Speed by 3 stages.

Name: Spreader Seed
Description: A seed that causes the Pokémon to share the effects of moves used on it.

Name: Vile Seed
Description: A seed that lowers the Pokémon's Defense and Special Defense by 3 stages.

Name: Via Seed
Description: It is a Lookalike Item for the Vile Seed. Eating it causes user to say ''See Ya!'' and warp to a random room!

Name: Wonder Tile
Description: Standing on this tile will resets all the Pokemon's stat changes. Even positive ones!

Name: Barrage Tile
Description: While standing on this tile; the user can use a move two times in a row in one turn! The move's PP will be reduced as if the Pokemon used it two times.

Name: Dodge Tile
Description: While on this tile; the Pokemon can dodge moves more easily!

Name: Heal Tile
Description: While on this tile; bad statuses won't affect the Pokemon!

Name: Pierce Tile
Description: Throw items while on this tile; and they will go through both enemies and walls; continuing on forever!

Name: Taunt Tile
Description: While on this tile; the Pokemon can't use status moves. However; the Pokemon's damaging attacks will become more powerful.

Name: Weight Tile
Description: The heavier the Pokémon on this tile is; the better chance it will have at landing critical hits when attacking an enemy!

Name: Mystery Tile
Description: Looks like a switch... it's a mystery what it will do once it's activated.

Name: Warp Zone
Description: Looks like a Warp Trap; but it actually allows the team to exit a dungeon after a successful exploration.

Name: Rescue Point
Description: Looks like Stairs; but it actually allows the team to exit a dungeon after a successful rescue. Send an A-OK mail to rescue the defeated team.

Name: Apple Trap
Description: Turns a random item in the Bag into an Apple.

Name: Self Destruct Trap
Description: Causes a blast in a 3×3 area that deals 50% HP damage! Items; walls; and tiles within the blast range are destroyed; including this trap. It will fail if it's raining or one of the hit Pokemon has the ability Damp.

Name: Explosion Trap
Description: Causes a big blast in a 5x5 area that deals 50% HP damage! Items; walls; and tiles within the blast range are destroyed; including this trap. It will fail if it's raining or one of the hit Pokemon has the ability Damp.

Name: Chestnut Trap
Description: Drops chestnuts onto the Pokemon; dealing 50% HP damage! However; it also drops a Chestnut. The edible kind.

Name: Discord Trap
Description: Gives the entire party the Discord status condition.

Name: Emera Crush Trap
Description: Destroys an Emera attached to the Pokemon's looplet.

Name: Emera Swap Trap
Description: An emera in the Pokémon's looplet is changed into a different emera.

Name: Grimy Trap
Description: Triggering this trap makes it spew a muck that gums up food.

Name: Grudge Trap
Description: Triggering this trap gives the Grudge status to all opposing Pokémon in the area.

Name: Gust Trap
Description: The Pokémon that stepped on it is sent flying 10 squares in any direction. Hitting a wall or Pokémon causes 10 damage.

Name: Hunger Trap
Description: Reduces Belly by 10.

Name: Mud Trap
Description: Triggering this trap makes it blow mud that lowers the highest stat by 3 stages!

Name: Pitfall Tile
Description: When triggered; the entire party falls to the next floor!

Name: PP Leech Trap
Description: Reduces the last used move's PP to 0!

Name: Progress Point
Description: A Progress Point tile that allows the team to save their progress in the middle of a Mystery Dungeon!

Name: Progress Point Plus
Description: A Progress Point Plus tile that allows the team to save their progress in the middle of a Mystery Dungeon; or even escape from the dungeon without losing any progress!

Name: Random Tile
Description: Turns into a random tile when stepped on! Yes; even traps!

Name: Slow Trap
Description: Reduces Movement Speed by 1.

Name: Slumber Trap
Description: Causes the Sleep status.

Name: Spiked Trap
Description: Deals 30 damage. This can be created by using the move Spikes!

Name: Stealth Rock Trap
Description: Deals 15% damage. This can be created by using the move Stealth Rock!

Name: Sticky Trap
Description: Causes the Pokemon's held item to become sticky. If no item is held; it will make one random item in the inventory sticky. It will also make the pokemon immobilized.

Name: Toxic Spike Trap
Description: Deals 10 damage and inflicts Poison. This can be created by using the move Toxic Spikes!

Name: Trip Trap
Description: Causes the Pokemon to faceplant and drop the Pokemon's held item! If no held item is held; it will drop a random item in the Pokemon's inventory.

Name: Sealed Door
Description: A door with no lock. Maybe there's a switch somewhere...?

Name: Sign
Description: A wooden sign. Some gibberish is scribbled on it...

Name: Stairs
Description: Stairs leading to the next floor. If user are on the final floor; user will escape from the dungeon.

Name: Secret Stairs
Description: Stairs leading to an unknown location.

Name: Signal Area
Description: A mysterious signal that calls Pokémon to the area.

Name: Compass Tile
Description: A tile that shows the way to important locations on the floor.

Name: Luminous Area
Description: A mysterious area that allows Pokémon to evolve.

Name: Reset Tile
Description: A switch that resets the floor; returning all items; traps; and wild Pokémon to their original positions as if nothing happened.

Name: Switch Tile
Description: A switch that opens various blocked passageways found on the floor.

Name: Training Switch
Description: Stepping on this tile gives the Trained status to the party.

Name: Pitfall Trap
Description: Stepping on this trap drops the Pokémon to the floor below; inflicting damage.

Name: Poison Trap
Description: Triggering this trap will shoot poison spikes in all directions. Pokémon hit will become poisoned.

Name: Pokémon Trap
Description: Triggering this trap transforms all items in the area into hostile Pokémon!

Name: Seal Trap
Description: Triggering this trap disables the last-used move of all nearby Pokémon.

Name: Spikes
Description: Stepping on this trap damages the Pokémon standing on it.

Name: Spin Trap
Description: Triggering this trap spins the Pokémon around dizzyingly; making them confused.

Name: Summon Trap
Description: Triggering this trap releases a sweet aroma that attracts Pokémon from afar.

Name: Trigger Trap
Description: Triggering this trap sets off all other traps in the area.

Name: Warp Trap
Description: Triggering this trap instantly warps the Pokémon to another spot on the floor.

Name: Shop Tile
Description: If you're reading this; you're currently standing inside a roaming Kecleon Shop! You should feel honored! Just don't steal anything alright?

Name: Empty Chest
Description: Oh no! Someone took the contents of this Treasure Chest!

Name: Treasure Chest
Description: It's a Treasure Chest. It's an actual; tangible; real Treasure Chest. Open it! Quick!

Name: Sealed Block
Description: A massive block is standing in the way. Maybe there's a switch somewhere...?

Name: White Door
Description: A massive white door with a lock. Whoever built it wanted to make it very obvious that it's white...

Name: Black Door
Description: A massive black door with a lock. Whoever built it wanted to make it very obvious that it's black...

Name: Blue Door
Description: A massive blue door with a lock. Whoever built it wanted to make it very obvious that it's blue...

Name: Green Door
Description: A massive green door with a lock. Whoever built it wanted to make it very obvious that it's green...

Name: Red Door
Description: A massive red door with a lock. Whoever built it wanted to make it very obvious that it's red...

Name: Yellow Door
Description: A massive yellow door with a lock. Whoever built it wanted to make it very obvious that it's yellow...

Name: Twenty Sided Die
Description: A baffling die that not only somehow increases the holder's Critical Hit rate to 1 in 20, but locks it there permanently.

Name: Growth Mulch
Description: Makes growth time of a Berry plant 75% of usual; but causes soil to dry out 50% faster.

Name: Damp Mulch
Description: Makes soil dry out 50% slower; but causes growth time of a Berry plant to be 150% of usual.

Name: Stable Mulch
Description: Makes Berries stay on plant for 150% of usual time before dropping off.

Name: Gooey Mulch
Description: Makes Berry plants regrow from dead plants 150% of usual number of times.

Name: Rich Mulch
Description: When applied to a Berry patch; increases the final Berry harvest by 2 Berries.

Name: Surprise Mulch
Description: When applied to a Berry patch; increases the chance of Berry mutation.

Name: Boost Mulch
Description: When applied to a Berry patch; causes the soil to dry out in 4 hours.

Name: Amaze Mulch
Description: When applied to a Berry patch; has the combined effects of the other types of mulch introduced in Generation VI: soil dries quicker; final harvest increases by 2 Berries; and Berry mutations are more likely.

Name: Assembly Box
Description: A marvelous box that allows the user to send or retrieve one Pokemon to the Assembly.

Name: Recall Box
Description: A marvelous box that lets the user recall one move they've learned in the past while inside a Dungeon.

Name: Storage Box
Description: A marvelous box that lets the user add one item from storage into the Treasure Bag.

Name: Link Box
Description: A marvelous box that lets the user link two moves together.

Name: Progress Device
Description: A machine that allows user to create a Progress Point tile and save the Pokemon's progress in the middle of a Mystery Dungeon!

Name: Progress Device Plus
Description: An incredible machine that allows user to create a Progress Point Plus tile and save the Pokemon's progress in the middle of a Mystery Dungeon; or even escape from the dungeon without losing any progress!

Name: Pass Orb
Description: A mysterious orb containing the power of a faraway land. Activates Pass Powers inside the Entralink.

Name: Smoke Ball
Description: A quick escape tool that breaks upon use. Gives the whole team Run Away status; and every enemy in the room Blinker status.

Name: Escape Rope
Description: Allows the team to climb back to the previous floor; just in case they missed something or need to get out of trouble.

Name: Fishing Rod
Description: Used to grab items that fell in water. Or; well; fishing.

Name: Dowsing Machine
Description: Use to find hidden items under the floor.

Name: Poké Flute
Description: A rare flute that awakens all enemy Pokemon on the floor from sleep. Doesn't work on teammates though.

Name: Time Flute
Description: A soothing flute that purifies nearby Shadow Pokemon by 10 when used...

Name: Philosopher Stone
Description: An extremely rare stone that's said to give limitless wealth; but only to the worthy. When used; randomly transmutates an item for another of equal value; in exchange for 50% HP.

Name: Lockpick
Description: Has a 1% chance of opening any locked door. Consumed after use.

Name: Secret Slab
Description: Glows in the bag when Legendary or Mythical Pokemon are detected in the current floor.

Name: Technical Machine
Description: An empty Technical Machine disc. If one of the Pokemon's moves is level 10 (X); user can reset it's level to copy the move in the disc and teach that move to any other Pokemon!

Name: Used Technical Machine
Description: A Technical Machine that's been copied and used. If user know the move Recycle; user might be able to recover the data!

Name: Move Manual
Description: A manual that increases a move's level as if it's been used 100 times. Practice!

Name: Mystery Part
Description: Makes roaming Legendary or Mythical Pokemon more likely to appear in Dungeons.

Name: Chalky Stone
Description: Allows the user to write something on a sign. What would you use this for...?

Name: Music Box
Description: An enchanting music box that plays a beautiful melody. It is said to draw something special to it when it is kept close by.
Recipe: Rock Part + Ice Part + Steel Part

Name: Glass Bottle
